categories.title: Patterns You Already Know… in AI
categories.description: Classic software design patterns reimagined for AI systems, bringing proven architectural concepts to the world of agents and language models.

categories.title: Orchestration & Reasoning
categories.description: Patterns for coordinating AI agents and managing complex reasoning workflows, including planning, execution, and reflection loops.

categories.title: Agent Lifecycle & Composition
categories.description: Patterns for creating, managing, and composing AI agents throughout their lifecycle, from instantiation to disposal.

categories.title: Knowledge & Context
categories.description: Patterns for managing knowledge, context, and memory in AI systems, including retrieval, storage, and context window optimization.

categories.title: Protocols & Interop
categories.description: Standardized communication patterns and protocols for AI systems to interact with each other and external services.

categories.title: Safety & Policy
categories.description: Patterns for ensuring AI system safety, implementing governance policies, and managing risk in AI applications.

categories.title: Quality & Evaluation
categories.description: Patterns for measuring, testing, and improving the quality of AI system outputs and behaviors.

categories.title: Cost, Latency & Reliability
categories.description: Patterns for optimizing AI system performance, managing costs, reducing latency, and ensuring reliable operation.

categories.title: UX & Product Integration
categories.description: Patterns for creating intuitive user experiences and seamlessly integrating AI capabilities into products and applications.

categories.title: Ops & Telemetry
categories.description: Patterns for operating AI systems in production, including monitoring, debugging, and maintaining AI applications at scale.

patterns.title: Agent Factory
patterns.description: AI-native version of Factory: quickly instantiates agents from recipes.

patterns.title: Disposable Agents
patterns.description: Single-use scripts designed to be fast to create and discard after execution.

patterns.title: Adaptive Model Routing
patterns.description: Strategy pattern applied to AI: dynamically choose between models or tools.

patterns.title: Streaming & Callbacks
patterns.description: Observer applied to LLMs: stream partial outputs and notify clients incrementally.

patterns.title: Guardrail Decorator
patterns.description: Decorator applied to AI: wrap model calls with critics, validators, or retries.

patterns.title: Tool Proxy
patterns.description: Proxy applied to AI: safe, controlled access to external tools and APIs.

patterns.title: Tool Fallbacks
patterns.description: Circuit Breaker applied to AI: detect tool failures and fall back gracefully.

patterns.title: ACV (Agent–Controller–View)
patterns.description: MVC reimagined for AI: separate planning, execution, and UI for clarity.

patterns.title: Plan–Act–Reflect
patterns.description: Agents loop through planning, execution, and reflection to improve reliability.

patterns.title: ReAct with Tools
patterns.description: Interleave reasoning steps with explicit tool calls and observable traces.

patterns.title: Subgoal Checkpoints
patterns.description: Break tasks into measurable subgoals with acceptance criteria.

patterns.title: Critic–Editor Loop
patterns.description: Draft, critique, and edit iteratively to boost output quality.

patterns.title: Multi-Agent Debate
patterns.description: Use multiple agents to argue solutions and converge on consensus.

patterns.title: Memory Triad
patterns.description: Divide memory into episodic, semantic, and procedural layers.

patterns.title: RAG 2.0
patterns.description: Segment, retrieve, and synthesize context using hybrid retrieval.

patterns.title: Context Windows as Contracts
patterns.description: Treat the context window as a strict contract for what knowledge is included.

patterns.title: Fact Pinning
patterns.description: Guarantee inclusion of critical facts in prompts to prevent omissions.

patterns.title: Guardrail Sandwich
patterns.description: Apply safety filters before, during, and after execution.

patterns.title: Policy-as-Prompt
patterns.description: Embed governance policies directly into prompts or system instructions.

patterns.title: Risk-Scored Escalation
patterns.description: Route outputs through human review when risk scores exceed thresholds.

patterns.title: MCP (Model Context Protocol)
patterns.description: Standard protocol for exchanging context and tool contracts across agents.

patterns.title: Multi-Agent Messaging Bus
patterns.description: Structured channel for communication between multiple agents.

patterns.title: Schema-First IO
patterns.description: Constrain inputs/outputs to strict schemas with validation and retries.

patterns.title: Offline Eval Harness
patterns.description: Framework for evaluating agent behavior against golden datasets.

patterns.title: Critique-as-Data Loop
patterns.description: Turn critiques and feedback into training/evaluation data.

patterns.title: Shadow / A-B / Gradual Rollout
patterns.description: Release changes in controlled phases to reduce risk.

patterns.title: Intent → Contract → UI
patterns.description: Convert user intent into a contract that generates UI elements.

patterns.title: Explainable Trace
patterns.description: Expose reasoning steps and tool calls to make outputs transparent.

patterns.title: Confidence-Weighted UI
patterns.description: Visualize model confidence and uncertainty in the interface.

patterns.title: Interactive Correction
patterns.description: Allow users to steer or correct outputs in real time.

patterns.title: Draft-then-Approve
patterns.description: Require human approval of drafts before final execution.

patterns.title: Undoable Actions
patterns.description: Design agent actions to be reversible by default.

patterns.title: Versioned Prompts & Agents
patterns.description: Track and version-control prompts and agent definitions.

patterns.title: Telemetry-First Agents
patterns.description: Build agents with monitoring and logging as first-class concerns.

patterns.title: Observability Hooks
patterns.description: Embed hooks for tracing, metrics, and debugging into workflows.

patterns.title: Chaos Testing for Agents
patterns.description: Introduce controlled failures to validate resilience and recovery.

patterns.title: Prompt Drift Detection
patterns.description: Detect and alert when prompts or behaviors diverge from baselines.
